utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Five. Six. Seven. Eight. One and two. Three and f--

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why are you all Beyoncé this morning? You got a school dance coming up?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No. Ashley gave me some of her cheer routine. She's been on the J.V. for two years, and she wants me to try out for the squad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cheerleading?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who are you and what have you done with my daughter?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What’s wrong with cheerleading?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no, nothing's - nothing's... I'm just- I didn’t know you... wanted to be one.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Me either. But I watched Ashley practice, and it looks like fun. And my college counselor, Ms. Schaefer, said I need to consider diversifying my activities. I figure I'm a natural 'cause I root for you all the time. Oh, I gotta go. Love you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Have fun.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Five. Six. Seven. Eight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cheerleading?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: So? The time you wanted to play hockey because all the cool guys in school were playing it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but I didn't join the team.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, no, because you knocked out two teeth at the first practice. Darling... let Alexis figure this out on her own, hmm?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This coming from the woman who just last week told me not to reserve a seat on the space shuttle?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh. Well, we have to rethink that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Vic's a female, late 20s, no I.D. She was found hanging from the monkey bars by a jogger just after dawn.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that honey?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: From the smell of it, I'd say it's caramel sauce. But I'll be testing, not tasting.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Caramel sauce?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe our killer has a sweet tooth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Given her state of undress, I'd say it's more likely he had a sexual fetish.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah, I can do the chocolate, I'll even do the whipped cream bikini, but caramel? I prefer slippery to sticky.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Does she know we can hear her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bondage cuffs, custom made? Looks like our killer liked public play.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How can you tell the difference between custom and regular?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The leather is too high quality to be mass-produced, and it's hand-stitched.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I mean, how can you tell the difference?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So time of death?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: From body temperature, I'd say between 10:00 and 11:00 last night, but I'm pretty sure she was not killed here. Based on lividity, she spent several hours in the fetal position after she died. And then was hung here a few hours ago. Petechial hemorrhaging suggests she was suffocated. And then there's these.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was she restrained?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Looks like it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, Beckett. Crime scene’s negative for any signs of a struggle. Found about a dozen partial shoe impressions, but the ground's too cold to get any imprints.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But... we did find this. Wheel marks, about 18 inches apart.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Rolling suitcase?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And judging by the depth of the tracks, I'd say it was carrying something heavy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I'm guessing around, uh, 105 pounds.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he killed her elsewhere and then brought her here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, which means the crime scene could be anywhere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The psychology doesn't make any sense. The crime scene was pretty elaborately staged, which seems to suggest a significant amount of premeditation, but the murder itself- suffocation- might indicate a crime of passion.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Guy covered her in caramel. Do you really think we're gonna find a logical explanation?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Only a handful of bondage shops in the city do custom work. So let's take photos of those cuffs, send it out, see if anyone can I.D. where it came from.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: "Only a handful of shops"? Okay, what aren’t you telling me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So much, Castle. So very, very much.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It's a little creepy doing this with you breathing on my neck.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, sorry, bro. I mean, I'd do it on mine, but I.A. checks browser history, so...

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Great. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What does that thing do?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like a potato peeler.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Oh, that is nasty. Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And illegal in 12 states.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, you're right. That is weird. Okay. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What's weird?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie ran a SART kit. There's no signs of sexual assault or activity. This has all the makings of a sex crime, but there's no sex involved.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe our psychopath believes in abstinence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It's more likely he has a performance problem. And there's no I.D. Her fingerprints aren't in the system.

utterance.speaker: RYAN AND ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh! No, no, no, no, no.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How do you even get in that position?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don't know, but you should try that with your, uh, girlfriend, honey milk. As a matter of fact, I think I'm gonna buy this for you right now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, jeez. How do you even get in that position?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Right? It's not even possible.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, it's possible.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anything on the canvass?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nothing yet. And nothing back from missing persons. Given that it just happened last night, it's most likely not gonna be reported for a couple of days.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about the cuffs?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We found seven shops in Manhattan that make custom bondage gear.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And while we're waiting to hear back, we're gonna buy a gift for Ryan's imaginary girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh, yeah. When are we gonna meet that Jenny?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: When the time is right, I'll bring her around. I don't want you guys scaring her off.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, there she is now. Ugh. I don't know.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hello. Detective Kevin Ryan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys, give him a break. I wouldn't bring my boyfriend around here either.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Boyfriend? Did I miss something?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So that was Barry from the Love Shackle. He says the cuff might be theirs, but he'd have to examine 'em up close to know for sure.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, then have evidence pull them and tell them I'm coming.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, a field trip to a sex store. I love this case.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Look at him following her. Who's whipped, huh, me or him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You, bro, hands down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, while we're here, we should really pick up something for that new imaginary boyfriend of yours. Oh, this his speed?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. But if you keep talking, I'll put you in one of these.

utterance.speaker: BARRY
utterance.content: Hey, guys. Looking for something special?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BARRY
utterance.content: Just gettin' started, huh? Yeah, we get a lot of first timers. We carry everything from bondage 101 all the way up to the more advanced stuff for your pleasure PhD. But if you're just looking to dip your toe in the water, these little guys are best sellers. Want to give 'em a try?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, thanks. I've already got a pair of my own.

utterance.speaker: BARRY
utterance.content: Double cross lap stitch on the seam. Yeah, this is definitely one of mine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you tell us who ordered them?

utterance.speaker: BARRY
utterance.content: Yeah, I remember this kid. Very vanilla. Then again, it's always the normal-looking ones that end up being the most freaky, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you have a name or a billing address?

utterance.speaker: BARRY
utterance.content: Yeah. The cuffs were purchased six months ago by a Tyler Benton. He had 'em specially made for his girlfriend. Cute girl, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You remember her?

utterance.speaker: BARRY
utterance.content: Yeah, brunette, mid-20s, asked a lot of questions.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she by any chance look like this?

utterance.speaker: BARRY
utterance.content: Oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We need to talk to Tyler Benton and find out what he was doing last night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My guess is killing his girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: TYLER BENTON
utterance.content: That's Jessica. Jessica Margolis- my girlfriend. Next week was our one-year anniversary. I was going to propose.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you last night, Mr. Benton?

utterance.speaker: TYLER
utterance.content: At the hospital. I'm a first year. I was working a 24-hour shift. You can ask my attending.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have you ever seen these before?

utterance.speaker: TYLER
utterance.content: Yeah, I-I bought them for Jessica a few months ago. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She was found hanging by them in the park. You guys like to play?

utterance.speaker: TYLER
utterance.content: What? No. We never even used them. They were- they were just supposed to be a joke because of her research.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Research?

utterance.speaker: TYLER
utterance.content: I tried to be supportive, but I should've stopped her. I should've pushed her to study something else.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was she studying?

utterance.speaker: TYLER
utterance.content: The sociology of sexual bondage and domination. She spent months meeting people in that world, trying to understand what made them tick. And they killed her for it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And where did you keep these cuffs?

utterance.speaker: TYLER
utterance.content: I don't- I don't know. At her place, I guess. Her roommate probably knows. The two of them were, like, attached at the hip.

utterance.speaker: DANIELLE
utterance.content: Jessica and I have been roommates since freshman year. We've lived together so long, we're practically sisters.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tyler said that you might know where she kept the cuffs he gave her.

utterance.speaker: DANIELLE
utterance.content: Oh, she showed them to me when she got them, but I never saw them after that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when was the last time that you saw Jessica?

utterance.speaker: DANIELLE
utterance.content: Yesterday morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about her research? Did she ever talk to you about where she went, uh, the people involved?

utterance.speaker: DANIELLE
utterance.content: No, she pretty much kept all that to herself.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So the bed hasn't been slept in. There's no signs of a struggle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cell phone, purse?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nada.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means she was somewhere else where she was killed. Okay, let's put a trace on her cell phone. If she has a GPS locator, we might get lucky.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did Jessica ever mention where she was going to be last night?

utterance.speaker: DANIELLE
utterance.content: No. I-I got in at around 10:00. It didn't look like she had been home. Since Tyler was on call, I... I assumed she was up at the university working on her thesis.

utterance.speaker: PROFESSOR STEVENSON
utterance.content: I wish I could help you, detective. Sometimes she'd work late, but she wasn't here last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure about that?

utterance.speaker: STEVENSON
utterance.content: I was here till 11:00 grading papers. I would've seen her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: As her advisor, how much would you know about the people that she was researching?

utterance.speaker: STEVENSON
utterance.content: She was spending a lot of time with a dominatrix named Mistress Venom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mistress Venom?

utterance.speaker: STEVENSON
utterance.content: Sounds more like "Penthouse Forum" than PhD. Mr. Castle, people who study sex-related fields are often derided within academia. Jessica was determined not to be held hostage by their little minds. Venom was Jessica's guide to that world. If you want to know more about the people Jessica was studying, you'll have to ask Venom. Kelly, this is Detective Beckett and Richard Castle. They need to see Jessica's research.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She kept her notes locked up?

utterance.speaker: KELLY
utterance.content: She was a finalist for the Kellerman fellowship. You know, when you're competing against other people in the department, the last thing you want to do is leave your notes lying around.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it looks like a lot of late nights.

utterance.speaker: KELLY
utterance.content: When Tyler was on shift, she'd just pull an all-nighter and go visit him on his breaks.

utterance.speaker: MATT
utterance.content: Kelly, did you hear how they found her?

utterance.speaker: KELLY
utterance.content: Matt--

utterance.speaker: MATT
utterance.content: Tied to the monkey bars on a playground in her underwear?

utterance.speaker: KELLY
utterance.content: Matt, um, this is Detective Beckett. She's here investigating Jessica's death. Matt, Jess and I all started the PhD program at the same time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can tell you were close.

utterance.speaker: MATT
utterance.content: I'm sorry. It's just-

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Kelly, did Jessica have any enemies in the department? Anyone in school that she didn't get along with?

utterance.speaker: MATT
utterance.content: Just because we were competing for the same fellowship doesn't mean that we weren’t civil.

utterance.speaker: KELLY
utterance.content: Not everyone was civil. In the last few weeks, Jessica was getting these phone calls on her office line.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of calls?

utterance.speaker: KELLY
utterance.content: Um, heavy breathing, moaning. Made you want to take a hand sanitizer shower.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seems a little immature for grad students.

utterance.speaker: MATT
utterance.content: Look, I'm studying the impact of A.I.D.S. treatments in inner-city clinics. Kelly's is about overcoming the glass ceiling. And Jessica was watching a dominatrix dig her stiletto into some loser's chest. She was bound to get some grief for it.

utterance.speaker: JANITOR
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jessica's notes on Venom's sessions are pretty detailed. She studied these guys like lab rats.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But she only identifies them by nickname - "ladyboy," "pin cushion" and "scared bunny."

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, if they didn't know what Jessica was doing, and one of them found out...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fear of exposure would be a strong motive to kill.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wonder what attracted her to all this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, according to her thesis proposal, she became interested in S_M after witnessing a dysfunctional relationship up close. Apparently her dissertation compares the overt expressions of dominance in the dungeon to more subtle expressions in real-world relationships... Like who drives.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, I would drive if you would let me. That actually didn't prove my point like I thought it would.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, it says here that Mistress Venom works in a bondage club somewhere in Dungeon Alley, but it doesn't say which one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dungeon Alley.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It's an area between Chelsea and Midtown. There's a whole slew of fetish clubs there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, I know where Dungeon Alley is. I want to know... How do you know?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Vice raided a few of them looking for a reason to shut them down. But since there's no sexual contact and the acts are all consensual, it was perfectly legal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm. You know, you should moonlight. Seriously, you would make a fortune. Come on. Haven't you ever wanted to do... something with your handcuffs other than arrest criminals?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. But there is one hot... wild... kinky thing that I do like doing. Putting killers behind bars.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See? You're already a tease. You're halfway there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, we tried to trace the creepy calls that Jessica was getting at her office. But since they were routed through the main switchboard at the college, there's no way to determine their source.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about the cell phone?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The day she died, she placed a call to her boyfriend at the hospital, she placed a call to her voice mail at the office, and she placed two calls to Lady Irena's House of Pain.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lady Irena's House of Pain? That must be where Mistress Venom works. Did you get an address?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, an office building on 38th.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, conveniently located for all your lunchtime spanking needs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, you guys look through her notes, see if there's anything that's there that might implicate one of her clients. Meanwhile, Castle and I will go and meet this Mistress Venom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whips, women and murder - sounds like my lucky day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm so glad you're excited by this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi, my name is Kate, and my boyfriend has been a very bad boy. Yes, that's right. His name's Ricky.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, a friend of mine recommended a Mistress Venom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is she available tonight? 4:00 pm?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sure, that's perfect. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, that's very funny. Now call her back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Unh-unh, Castle. This is the perfect way to get Venom without tipping our hand. What's the matter, Castle? You afraid of a little role play?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, you better run.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This place looks like a law firm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What'd you think it was gonna be, torture wheels and women in corsets?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That's in the back.

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: Welcome to Lady Irena's House of Pain. How can I serve you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, answer her! You see what I have to deal with? My boyfriend Ricky has an appointment at 4:00 pm with Mistress Venom.

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: Will you be joining him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, yes. I've been dying to watch him squirm.

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: Mistress Venom would be delighted to have an audience. Follow me, please.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you think we could gag him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Remember, my safe word is "apples."

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You should bring your new boyfriend here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mistress Venom?

utterance.speaker: LADY IRENA
utterance.content: Mistress Venom is unavailable. But I'm Lady Irena. I own this dungeon. I'm sure we can find another dominatrix to suit your needs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm afraid we can't. I'm Detective Beckett. I need to speak with her right now concerning a murder investigation.

utterance.speaker: LADY IRENA
utterance.content: Who was murdered?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jessica Margolis. The PhD student who was observing her sessions.

utterance.speaker: LADY IRENA
utterance.content: There was no one observing her sessions.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: LADY IRENA
utterance.content: Positive. Privacy is paramount in my dungeon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You've never seen this girl?

utterance.speaker: LADY IRENA
utterance.content: Of course I've seen that girl. She wasn't observing Mistress Venom. She was Mistress Venom.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, this explains the marks on her body. Jessica must have been wearing this before she died.

utterance.speaker: LADY IRENA
utterance.content: Like cruel shoes, these outfits can leave marks for hours after you wear them. She had three sessions yesterday. She left around 7:30.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You really had no idea that Jessica was conducting a sociological experiment out of your dungeon?

utterance.speaker: LADY IRENA
utterance.content: No. She came to me about six months ago. Quickly became one of my most requested doms.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did Jessica have any clients who were unusually obsessed with her?

utterance.speaker: LADY IRENA
utterance.content: Of course. I mean, they all were. But her clients were submissive. Killing is an act of dominance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You and I both know that people aren't that simple. Men might come here for humiliation and torture, but it's easy to imagine that one of them might have been pushed too far and lashed out.

utterance.speaker: LADY IRENA
utterance.content: If she was concerned for her safety, she would've told me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you have a list of Jessica's clients?

utterance.speaker: LADY IRENA
utterance.content: Detective... All of the services that we provide here are perfectly legal. Now part of that service is protecting the privacy of our client. I'm not about to betray the trust that they've paid for because you have a hunch.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, I think it's more than just a hunch.

utterance.speaker: LADY IRENA
utterance.content: Well, gee, I'm sorry. Unless you have a court order, my hands are tied, so to speak.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You're pretty well-versed in law for a dominatrix.

utterance.speaker: LADY IRENA
utterance.content: Don't let the leather fool you. I used to be a partner at a law firm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: LADY IRENA
utterance.content: When you dominate and manipulate men in every boardroom and courtroom that you're in, this just seemed like the natural progression.

utterance.speaker: LADY IRENA
utterance.content: It's called Mistress Red.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: LADY IRENA
utterance.content: My lipstick. I noticed you couldn't stop staring.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry. It was just hypnotic.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It's not you. It's her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, if you're so upset, we could find someone for you to go medieval on, like, uh, him perhaps.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She wants to protect her clients? What about her girls?

utterance.speaker: MISTRESS SAPPHIRE
utterance.content: Hey. You the cop?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: MISTRESS SAPPHIRE
utterance.content: I'm Mistress Sapphire. So it's true? She's dead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. I'm sorry-

utterance.speaker: MISTRESS SAPPHIRE
utterance.content: This weird thing happened last week, I think you should know about.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With one of her clients?

utterance.speaker: MISTRESS SAPPHIRE
utterance.content: Sort of. A first-time client came in for a session, but he left just after a few minutes. I found her in the locker room, crying.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she tell you why?

utterance.speaker: MISTRESS SAPPHIRE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This client, do you remember anything about him?

utterance.speaker: MISTRESS SAPPHIRE
utterance.content: It was a week ago, and I only saw him from behind. But he was wearing one of those medical shirts.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Scrubs?

utterance.speaker: MISTRESS SAPPHIRE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You thinking what I'm thinking?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jessica's boyfriend discovered her secret identity.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And instead of proposing to her, he kills her.

utterance.speaker: TYLER
utterance.content: Jessica was the love of my life. Why would I want to hurt her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because she hurt you.

utterance.speaker: TYLER
utterance.content: What the hell are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You said so yourself. You wanted her to stop. You were gonna make her study something else. It must have been a real shocker when you realized she wasn't just studying that world, she was living it.

utterance.speaker: TYLER
utterance.content: What the hell is this? This is crazy. You're telling me this is real? You're telling me Jessica was one of them?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why did you go to the dungeon last week? Was it to confront her?

utterance.speaker: TYLER
utterance.content: The dungeon?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We have a witness who saw you there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It's completely understandable. The woman that you loved lied to you? I could see how you could lose control and go into a jealous rage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then in a panic, decide to stage the body in a manner so unusual, we'd naturally assume it was someone in the bondage world.

utterance.speaker: TYLER
utterance.content: I never went to a dungeon. There was no jealous rage because I didn't know! I was going to marry her. We just signed a lease to move in together three days ago. If I was so angry with her, why would I do that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was telling the truth about the lease. Not only did he and Jessica sign the lease, but it was also notarized.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: That doesn't mean he didn't do it. He coulda had her sign to help his alibi.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe she was afraid of him. I've been thinking - the dysfunctional relationship she refers to in her research - There's a passage where she describes subject "a" as being afraid to tell subject "b" that she's leaving because he's become dangerously codependent. What if she was describing Tyler?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Maybe that's why she became a dominatrix, to give her the courage to stand up for herself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We have uniforms combing through hospital security footage. If Tyler left at any point that night, there should be some trace.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: In the meantime, let's just keep digging through those notebooks. We're gonna need more than speculation if we want to file charges.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad! Do we need to talk about this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is research for a case.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And we need to get you some noisier shoes. Seriously, I – Hey, you made the team.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No. Tryouts aren't for another month, but Ashley let me take her uniform home to see how it fit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what do you think?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I think it's totally not me, which is why I kind of like it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's not you, so you like it?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah. You know how in Storm Fall, you killed off Derrick Storm because you were bored with him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Sometimes I feel that way about me, like I'm hiding inside my comfort zone. And maybe it's time to venture out a little.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, does that venture have to include pom-poms?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I don't want to look back on high school and feel like I missed out on something. So promise you'll be supportive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I, uh... I promise.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Go, dad! Whoo! Move, move, move. Get out of the way. 'cause The Bears are comin', and we're ready to play. Go, Bears!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You ever want to be a cheerleader?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Did you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not me. Alexis. She wants to try out for the team.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So? You see what they wear? She wants to join a team, why not join mathletes?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why can't she do both? Besides, kids try on personalities the way they try on clothes. It's the way that they figure out who they are.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you looking for?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: According to the security footage, the boyfriend never left the hospital during his shift. It wasn't him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he faked the footage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He's an intern, not Jason Bourne.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Well, there goes my subject "b" theory.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Jessica left the dungeon at 7:30, and she was killed sometime between 10:00 and 11:00. If she didn't go home or to the university, then where did she go?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Beckett. Something in here you gotta see.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It's one of Jessica's subjects. She calls him "Sam-I-am."

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because he has a Dr. Seuss fetish?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Because he's a SAM - "a smart-assed masochist." According to her notes, a SAM pretends he wants to be submissive, but what he actually wants to do is dominate his Mistress, usually with passive-aggression.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Instead of asking for what he wants, he makes a game out of making other people upset so they can be punished.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? There's people like that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Only these SAMs can be dangerous. Sometimes resorting to threats to provoke their response.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Listen to this. "He said Mistress Venom was the one who needed to be punished. He said he was going to find her, tie her up and drown her, but in something... sweet, like caramel."

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Sexual obsession and a description of the crime scene. Sounds like our guy to me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but we only got a nickname.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: We have more than a nickname. We have enough to force Lady Irena to turn over her client list.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Judge Markway, please.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh. Sounds like someone's gonna get punished.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: William Caraway, aka "Sam-I-am." Senior vice president at Stewart, Cabot and Sagansky.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The global consulting firm?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No wonder Lady Irena was protecting his identity.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, why don't you sit this one out? I think Mr. Caraway will respond better to a strong... female hand.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sam-I-am... in a box...

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: With a fox -

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We're gonna need some popcorn.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sit.

utterance.speaker: CARAWAY
utterance.content: First why don't you tell me why the hell I'm here? I got a board meeting -

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I said sit down... now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Good boy. Your Mistress would be very proud of you.

utterance.speaker: CARAWAY
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mistress Venom. Lady Irena's House of Pain. You like to be tied up, you like to be spanked, but more than anything, you like to make threats.

utterance.speaker: CARAWAY
utterance.content: I don't know what you're talking about.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There is no dominatrix-client privilege in New York. And your Mistress was very thorough in documenting your deepest, darkest desires - the thing with the matches, how you liked it messy.

utterance.speaker: CARAWAY
utterance.content: She wrote that down?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She also wrote how you wanted to turn the tables on her, how you threatened to tie her up and drown her in caramel.

utterance.speaker: CARAWAY
utterance.content: I-it's fantasy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But the fantasies weren't enough. And so you had to make your dreams come true.

utterance.speaker: CARAWAY
utterance.content: No, that's not possible.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The more she said no, the more you became obsessed. You didn't want to be the submissive. You wanted to dominate her, and the ultimate domination is murder.

utterance.speaker: CARAWAY
utterance.content: No, I swear. I didn't even know she was dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were very specific in your threats, and that's exactly how we found her. Do you really expect me to believe that that wasn't you?

utterance.speaker: CARAWAY
utterance.content: Well--well, someone must have found out. Someone could've read her notes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you two nights ago?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Caraway, where were you?

utterance.speaker: CARAWAY
utterance.content: I was with my wife. It was our anniversary.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: His wife confirms it. He was with her at the anniversary party all night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This staging was way too specific to be just a coincidence. Somebody knew.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe she told someone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe someone had access to the research. Filing cabinet's not Fort Knox. Anyone with access would've read exactly what we read and could use it to throw us off their trail.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. You and Ryan go back to the dungeon. See if any of the girls swap stories after work. Meanwhile, Castle and I will go to the university and see who had access to her research.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: MISTRESS
utterance.content: No, Mistress Venom never mentioned him to me, or any of her other clients.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Really? Come on. You girls don't share shop talk?

utterance.speaker: MISTRESS
utterance.content: You work here long enough, and the kinkiest things you could ever imagine... are just another day at the office. The only time we trade info is if we share clients, but Mistress Venom didn't share. Do you mind unstrapping my boot?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, thank you, Mistress Amber?

utterance.speaker: MISTRESS AMBER
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mistress Scorpion?

utterance.speaker: MISTRESS
utterance.content: Faster.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Is, uh, is there a possibility that she may have mentioned one client's fetishes to another client?

utterance.speaker: MISTRESS
utterance.content: Absolutely not. Lady Irena beats confidentiality rules into our heads. Mistress Venom wasn't stupid. Is there a problem?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just this knot. It's like an octagonal knot. It's got, like, eight sides. I've never seen a knot like -

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Detective Esposito, bringing crime to its knees.

utterance.speaker: MISTRESS
utterance.content: Stay.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So none of the girls claim that they remember Jessica talking about any of her clients. But I think we might have an explanation as to where she was between the time she left work and when she was killed. Uh, Mistress Scorpion thinks that Jessica might have been working off the books.

utterance.speaker: MISTRESS
utterance.content: Well, if she was, then she was asking for trouble. Nothing upsets Lady Irena more than some girl trying to screw her out of her 40%.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ow.

utterance.speaker: MISTRESS
utterance.content: Hey, Irish, you want to help out your little buddy here? He seems to be all thumbs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were her office mate, Kelly. It would've been very easy for you to access her files.

utterance.speaker: KELLY
utterance.content: No, it wouldn't. I told you. She was very private about her work.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You mean to tell me, she didn't once slip out to the bathroom and just leave her notes sitting on the desk?

utterance.speaker: KELLY
utterance.content: If she did, I wouldn't be interested, and the night she was killed, I was in Westchester with my folks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Does anyone else have access to this office?

utterance.speaker: KELLY
utterance.content: The only other person with a key to the office is maintenance.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about your keys? Did you ever lose them or lend them to a friend?

utterance.speaker: KELLY
utterance.content: No. I mean, I gave them to Matt last week because he said he had some papers here. What, you think he broke in to her filing cabinet and took her research?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That is exactly what I'm thinking. You said it yourself. It's a very competitive program. And they were both finalists for the same fellowship. This is, uh, Matt's proposal for studying the effect of A.I.D.S. on inner-city clinics. Look at the picture.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He's in scrubs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It wasn't Tyler who confronted Jessica at the dungeon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was Matt.

utterance.speaker: MATT
utterance.content: I borrowed Kelly's keys. That doesn't prove anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which is why we took a look at the whole picture. This is a list of phone calls made from your cell phone to the university switchboard. Each one coincides with a harassing call to Jessica.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You made those calls.

utterance.speaker: MATT
utterance.content: Look, it was a joke.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How about your little visit to Jessica at the dungeon last week? Was that a joke as well?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She didn't tell anybody where the dungeon was. So how'd you find it? Did you follow her or the clues in her research?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were her rival for a fellowship. You needed her out of the way. And when you read her research, you saw your chance.

utterance.speaker: MATT
utterance.content: Look, I needed that funding, okay? My work is important. I mean, come on. Seriously. I couldn't let her get that fellowship. And when I saw her research, I mean, it read like fiction. So I went to the dungeon to find out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you broke in to her filing cabinet, you copied her research, and then you followed her to the dungeon. You're not putting a whole lot of checks in the innocent column here, Matt.

utterance.speaker: MATT
utterance.content: The innocent column. Listen... I threatened her. All right? But I did not kill her. When I found out that she was Mistress Venom, I told her that if she didn't withdraw her fellowship application, I was gonna tell her boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And when that didn't work, you killed her?

utterance.speaker: MATT
utterance.content: It did work. Jessica withdrew her application the day before she was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do you know?

utterance.speaker: MATT
utterance.content: Because she blind copied me on an e-mail that she sent to the head of the committee. We were cool. What she was most concerned about was getting back this research that I copied. So as soon as she was out of the running, I brought it all back to her apartment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know you are morally challenged if your murder alibi is a blackmailing scheme.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but if he's telling the truth, then we have no motive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, hello, gentlemen. How was your trip to the dungeon?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we learned that Esposito is not very good with laces.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There were a lot of laces - I-I loosened 'em for you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, sure. None of the girls admit to Jessica sharing any of her client secrets with 'em.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, one of 'em thought that she might have been seeing clients outside of the dungeon, which might explain the hole in our timeline.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But we ran through her phones and financials again. We can't find any record of it. How out you? Hear you have a suspect.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Had. Matt was telling the truth. Jessica pulled out of the fellowship.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But if he was telling the truth, then where's all the research he brought back

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, maybe we missed something. Maybe she hid it somewhere. Or maybe Matt is lying about the research.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you didn't see a stack of paperwork?

utterance.speaker: DANIELLE
utterance.content: No, I would've noticed that. Maybe she took them up to school?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, it wasn't there either.

utterance.speaker: DANIELLE
utterance.content: Are you sure Matt's telling the truth?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Most people lie to avoid suspicion. Not a lot of people lie to incriminate themselves.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That night that you came home, did you notice anything different or out of place?

utterance.speaker: DANIELLE
utterance.content: Now that you mention it, I did find something odd. Earlier tonight I was emptying the dishwasher, and I found a wine glass with lipstick on it. It didn't seem like Jessica's shade, and it wasn't one of mine. I put it aside to hand-wash it later.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Recognize this shade?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If I'm not mistaken, and I rarely am, that's Mistress Red.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you know that lip prints are a lot like fingerprints? No two are exactly alike.

utterance.speaker: LADY IRENA
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We found this on a wine glass in Jessica's apartment. What do you think we'll find when we compare it to your lips?

utterance.speaker: LADY IRENA
utterance.content: That stain could've been there for months.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But it wasn't.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We checked with your... car service. They said they dropped you off at 9:00 pm in front of Jessica's place the night she was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were the last one to see her alive. What happened that night?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you find out who she really was, that she was studying her clients without their permission? I mean, if word of that got out... that would've destroyed your business. That can't have made you happy.

utterance.speaker: LADY IRENA
utterance.content: And you're grasping at straws, and that can't make you happy. Detective, at this time, I'm exercising my right to legal counsel. I won't be answering any further questions.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yo! How'd it go with Lady Irena?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She's lawyering up. What'd you guys find at Jessica's apartment?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, it looks like we found the crime scene. Irena was pretty good at cleaning up after herself. There was no trace or blood evidence, but the area around Jessica's bedside table lit up like a Christmas tree. It'd been scrubbed down with bleach.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That's why we didn't find Jessica's research. Irena got rid of it all.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but she didn't quite clean everything. Once C.S.U. stripped the bed, the swab test revealed dried saliva in one of her pillows from her screams as she was smothered.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like she'd do anything to protect her business, even kill.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, lawyer or not, let's book her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Let's do it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Are you straining those noodles or just my patience?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm? Oh, I'm... sorry. Just... This case. I keep thinking that I'm missing something.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yeah, me, too. Salt.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. W-whoa. Ee. Doh. Can you die from sodium poisoning?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ooh. You have a point.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey, that smells good.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But... I already ate?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, no.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So did you and Ashley do cheerleading practice?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh, no. Turns out, cheerleading conflicts with my fencing schedule, my violin lessons and French Club. Cheerleading is more of a lifestyle, and as much as I like to visit, it's not really a place I'd like to live.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I told you she'd figure it out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, we both learned a valuable lesson today. You learned that you can expand your horizons and grow. I learned that if that involves short skirts and boys, I'm not gonna like it.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Fair enough.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Fine. Now that you've both learned your lessons, how about starting on the dishes?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You're gonna need a fire hose to clean this up.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No, I cooked. Someone else cleans up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Clean up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who washed the pillowcase?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Esposito said C.S.U. didn't find anything until they stripped the bed. That means there was saliva on the pillow, but not on the pillowcase.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You're right. Someone washed the pillowcase. But the washer-dryer cycle would've taken at least an hour.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: At which point, the roommate would've been home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Irena couldn't have gotten out in time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only one person could've cleaned the apartment.

utterance.speaker: DANIELLE
utterance.content: I-I don't understand. I thought you'd caught the killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We thought so, too.

utterance.speaker: DANIELLE
utterance.content: If it wasn't her, then who?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was you, Danielle.

utterance.speaker: DANIELLE
utterance.content: Me? Oh, why would I kill my best friend?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In her research, Jessica describes being in a dysfunctional relationship, one she was scared to leave because the other person had become so dangerously codependent.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: At first we thought it was her boyfriend Tyler. But it wasn't, was it?

utterance.speaker: DANIELLE
utterance.content: I don't know what you're talking about.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The research that Matt dropped off – her research - must've been very hurtful to read all the things that she wrote about you.

utterance.speaker: DANIELLE
utterance.content: Jessica loved me. She would never hurt me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: "Subject 'b' shows all the signs of being a masochist, completely dependent for her sense of self."

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We know you read the files, Danielle. That's why you staged her body that way.

utterance.speaker: DANIELLE
utterance.content: No, I didn't read anything. There was nothing here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because you got rid of it all.

utterance.speaker: DANIELLE
utterance.content: You're wrong.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It had to have been you, Danielle. You were the only one who had time to clean up after yourself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Judging from her office space, Jessica wasn't the kind of girl that scrubbed her floor clean with bleach. Jessica told you... she had to get away from you. She told you... she was gonna leave.

utterance.speaker: DANIELLE
utterance.content: She... She was... everything to me. I thought we were family. But then she wrote those awful things! She had no right!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened that night?

utterance.speaker: DANIELLE
utterance.content: She said she was... gonna move out, that she was done with me. I pushed her. She fell. Her head... hit the table. She started to scream. She said--she said she hated me! I told her to shut up! I just wanted her to shut up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then you put a pillow over her head and you suffocated her.

utterance.speaker: DANIELLE
utterance.content: I... I didn't mean to kill her. I just didn't want her to go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: In the end, Castle was right. The murder was a crime of passion. The cuffs, the caramel were all just theater to throw us off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can't help but think that if Matt hadn't copied Jessica's research, Danielle never would've read it, and none of this woulda happened.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Well, now he won't get his precious little fellowship or his degree. What about Lady Irena? What was she doing at the apartment?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Some of the girls thought that Jessica was working off the books. So Irena came by to tell her to knock it off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They had a glass of wine, and she left. She just did it on the wrong night.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Yeah, but why'd she give you such a hard time, then?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because she's a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And a dominatrix.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. You made it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Guys, uh, I want you to meet... Jenny.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Welcome. We've heard wonderful things about you.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Oh, the same goes for all of you. I-I feel like I know you guys already. You are so much prettier than your picture in Cosmo. Kevin gave me his copy of Heat Wave. I could not put it down. And thanks for being such a great partner. You know, make sure you keep him safe out there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We have a movie to catch. I'll see you guys tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys have a great time.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Damn. If I had a girl like that, I might be whipped by her, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now we know why he didn't bring her around sooner.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the two of you don't act like idiots around her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, so we wouldn't try to steal her from him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what about this imaginary boyfriend of yours? Are we gonna see him around here or is he at home tied to a bed?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What's the matter, Ricky? You jealous?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. You only get to punish him at night. You punish me all day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, you deserve it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did I do to you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let's just start with the first day we met…
